['Alethea Group is hiring a Remote Analysis Manager Director 
\nAlethea Group is seeking a Manager or Director of Analysis (level to be determined based on experience) to join a fast-growing start-up committed to detecting and mitigating disinformation. A senior position, the Manager/Director of Analysis will report directly to the Senior Vice President of Analysis and is responsible for overseeing Alethea Group’s project teams of investigators and analysts as they undertake complex disinformation investigations and sophisticated client engagements to meet a dynamic set of customer needs. The Manager/Director of Analysis will also be responsible for managing day-to-day client relationships, working with clients to appropriately scope and resource custom projects, and editing analysis products to ensure they meet the highest analytic standards.\xa0\n\nThis is a distinctly managerial role, but it requires the successful candidate to themselves have extensive experience conducting complex investigations and producing high quality analysis, managing analytic teams, and mentoring analysts in the state-of-the-art as it pertains to analytic tradecraft. The Manager/Director of Analysis must be capable of – and comfortable with – expertly critiquing and interrogating the work of analysts and helping them iterate on investigative approaches and written outputs to ensure that they meet our standards of analytic excellence.\xa0\n\nResponsibilities include:\n\n\nManaging Alethea Group’s project teams of investigators and analysts as they undertake complex disinformation investigations.\n\nOwning the analysis editorial process and final editing for all customer-facing analytic products to ensure they meet the highest analytic and written standards.\xa0\n\nManaging day-to-day client relationships (including leading client meetings) and the timely delivery of their custom services contracts, including working with clients to meticulously scope and schedule projects and reports.\n\nIdentifying and developing opportunities to provide new analytic products and services to existing clients.\n\nMentoring analysts in investigative and analytic tradecraft and writing.\xa0\n\n\n\n\nQualifications:\n\n\n5+ years experience in an intelligence/threat intelligence/research setting conducting complex investigations and producing sophisticated written analytic products on adversary tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs), including 3+ years experience overseeing teams of analysts/investigators.\n\nDisinformation or Information Operations subject matter expertise is a huge plus. If the candidate does not have such expertise, they will need to demonstrate they have the ability to quickly develop it (for example by demonstrating expertise in a related field such as international politics, cybersecurity, extremism research etc). Current general familiarity with the topic of disinformation is critical.\n\nExtensive experience developing topics for and managing research, intelligence, and open source products.\xa0\n\nExperience managing stakeholder relationships and working with analysis consumers to scope and tailor custom investigations.\n\nSuperior experience producing high-quality written products that are succinct, logically structured, visually appealing, and tailored to the audience.\n\nDemonstrated ability to expertly critique and interrogate the analytic work of others and edit written outputs to ensure they meet the highest standards of analytic quality.\xa0\n\nStrong experience with OSINT investigative methodologies in the digital domain and/or social media analysis.\n\nStrong client-management skills, executive presence, and experience briefing decision makers orally with demonstrated ability to deliver key messages with clarity, confidence and poise.\n\nAbility to recognize and develop business opportunities to provide new analytic products and services to existing clients.\xa0\n\nSuperior organization and project management skills. A PMP certification is a huge plus.\xa0\n\nGeneral familiarity with/exposure to data analytics approaches and data visualization is preferred. You don’t need to be technical, but do need to be able to see past the glitz to interrogate data assumptions.\n\nExperience directly managing private-sector clients is a plus.\n\nDegrees are good. Impact is better.\n\n\n\n\nEqually important to the ability to perform the duties above, Alethea Group is especially interested in the cultural fit for our team:\n\n\nA relentlessly positive attitude and the ability to balance work and life efficiently in order to get the job done, without sacrificing sanity. A sense of humor is a plus.\n\nA roll up your sleeves attitude. This is a start-up, and no job is too small.\n\nIntegrity in unregulated, unchartered territory. There are very few rules governing the information space, and Alethea Group employees will be expected to demonstrate a commitment to the firm’s ethical standards.\n\nA constant desire to learn and be challenged by team members of all levels. Our titles are to help our clients identify roles and responsibilities, but on our teams, we should be challenging each other to think outside the box, develop creative solutions, and build something together.\n\nAn understanding of the political and economic systems in the United States, and how disinformation poses a threat to institutions.\n\nThe ability to demonstrate discretion. Our clients are sensitive. Their data is sensitive.\n\nThe ability to communicate directly and get the job done. We’re busy, so this isn’t a “meeting-before-the-meeting” kind of place.\n\nAn ability to thrive in ambiguity. Create a structure that works for you and your team. We are not micromanagers.\n\n\n\n\nSalary and Benefits:\n\n\nSalary and stock options will be negotiated based on experience.\n\nHealth care at the gold-tier level is fully funded by the employer.\n\nUnlimited sick leave, unlimited PTO, and 10 Federal Holidays.\n\nA flexible work schedule.\n\nRemote and telework options, with offices located in Washington, D.C.\n\nEmployer sponsored 401k.\n\n\n\n\n\xa0\n\nCandidates with non-traditional and diverse backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply.\n\n\xa0\n\nCOVID-19 precautions\n\n\nRemote interview process\n\nVirtual meetings\n\n\n\n\n\xa0\n\nOur office is remote during the COVID-19 pandemic, and will reopen once public health officials have determined it is safe to do so. At that time, staff will have the option to work from our Washington, D.C. office, but relocation is not required.\n\n\n\n \n\n#Salary and compensation\n
No salary data published by company so we estimated salary based on previous jobs related to Executive jobs that are similar:\n\n
$70,000 — $100,000/year\n

This role has to focus on bringing the best talent, creating a fun and light work environment, yet be able to see the big picture and understand how small actions make up a larger effort, strategizing as a CEO would.\n\nWe are in a crucial moment in which our unique culture needs to be guided in the direction we want so we achieve our strategic goals. ["Drizly is hiring a Remote People Operations Manager

Our customers trust us to be part of their lives – their celebrations, parties, dinners and quiet nights at home. We are there when it matters - committed to life’s moments and the people who create them. We partner with the best retail stores in over 1400 cities across North America to serve up the best buying experience. Drizly offers a huge selection and competitive pricing with a side of personalized content. That is what we do.\xa0 Who we are is a different story.\n\nWe are more than just another tech company. There is an intellectual curiosity that occurs at Drizly.\xa0 We have a desire to question, to understand, to figure it out. Bottom line, we solve it. We value not just the truth but the process to get to the truth, to deliberate, decide and then act.\xa0 Most importantly, we care. We care about our customer. We care about our company. We care about our team. There will be long days and incredible challenges.\n\nWe are blazing a trail in an industry that hasn’t changed in nearly a century, and that doesn’t scare us (well, not all the time) -and even when it does, it doesn’t stop us, it energizes us.\n\nDo you see yourself here?\xa0 Read on.\n\n\nWho you are\n\nYou are an action oriented problem solver. ['The Flatiron School is hiring a Remote Instructor Data Science 
\nAs a Data Science Instructor, you will be leading a specific group of Data Science students - leading them to rigorous academic success. You will be responsible for lecturing, coordinating key components of a student’s course structure, such as weekly one-on-ones, assessments, and project reviews, and act as their go-to technical resource and inspiration as they work through the program.\xa0\n\nYou’ll work with fellow Flatiron School staff to guide students through the course material, build community within our student body, troubleshoot student issues, and overall create productive, inspired, employable practitioners of a technical craft.\n\nInstructors need to be comfortable guiding students through applied and experiential learning experiences across a breadth of skill areas that are expected of data science professionals. Additionally, you may assist in onboarding new instructors and participate in internal and external events.\n\nThe Instructor will:\n\nWork directly with students, elevating them to meet our technical bar:\n\n\nDeliver a minimum of 75 lecture hours per cohort.\n\nMaintain the cadence of the course: Keep students on track, monitor each individual’s progress, and design and implement learning or service interventions when students fall behind.\n\nHold regular one-on-one and group coaching sessions with students that serve as tutoring, motivational, or debugging sessions — whatever particular student(s) need(s) that day to keep on track for their goals.\n\nHelp students in real-time, through one-on-one meetings, chat, and live video conversations, tending towards the most high-fidelity experiences.\n\nFacilitate Education Operations in Flatiron School’s Learning Management System.\n\nReview coursework by students and provide specific, highly qualitative, and useful feedback.\n\nLead project sprints, helping students scope and execute larger technical projects to demonstrate mastery of each content module.\n\nConduct assessments, holding students to a high bar of mastery for each content module and coaching them on how to deepen their understanding of the material.\n\nBuild community within student groups by identifying, creating, and implementing connective experiences, like ["Nextmv is hiring a Remote Decision Engineering Lead 
Nextmv is a remote-first company with over 20 employees working across the globe to change how companies automate and optimize their operations. We provide developers with the building blocks to create and test decision models, quickly. From logistics to healthcare to finance, every company can benefit from decision engineering using optimization and simulation. \n\nNextmv is changing the way companies make decisions. We’re driven by building useful products and creating a more human workplace. And we’d like your help.\n\nThe Opportunity\nAs an early member of the Decision Engineering team, you will have a large impact on leading the team working on the Nextmv Cloud console. Nextmv Cloud enables our customers to generate optimized routes for a fleet of vehicles given a number of operational constraints. In the future, Nextmv Cloud will support optimizing a wider range of decisions across various industries.\xa0\n\nNextmv Cloud is a serverless stack built in go and running on AWS, with a frontend based on React and TypeScript. We are looking for a team lead with 7+ years experience in some combination of software development, project management, and people management. In this role, you will report to our Vice President of Engineering.\n\nThe items above are a starting point for a conversation, not a hard list of requirements. If this role sounds exciting we encourage you to apply.\n\nThe compensation range for this role is $155,000 – $180,000 base pay, depending on experience and your personal choice of equity/salary balance. Learn more about our compensation philosophy and benefits below.\n\n\nBenefits\n• Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance - We cover Medical, Dental, and Vision for U.S. employees. In the future, we would like to offer the option to international employees.\n• Paid Family Leave - 14 weeks of paid leave for all new parents.\n• Retirement Planning - 401k with matching for U.S. teammates (100% of the first 1% + 50% of the next 5%)\n• Equity - Stock option plan on a standard 4 year vesting schedule with a 1 year cliff.\n• Financial Transparency - Everyone has access to financial and business metrics.\n• Half-Day Fridays - Year round, we do half-day Fridays\n• Minimum Vacation Policy - Unlimited vacation can be vague and hard to track. We strongly encourage everyone to take at least 3 week/year (or whatever is in line with your country's standard) in addition to public holidays. We also close the office for a week in December.\n• Retreats - We plan to hold company retreats for in-person work (when safe again).\n• Travel Stipend - We offer up to 3K annually to visit your teammates and work from another city (or country!)\n• Home Office Stipend - we send every new teammate a Mac laptop or equivalent of their choice, and provide a $1,000 stipend so you can feel ready to work from home.\n\nOur Compensation Philosophy\nWe strive to create a place where anybody can grow. We’re guided by the following core beliefs that keep us honest on this journey.\xa0\n\nA career in tech should be accessible to all\nNo matter where you are in your life or on the planet, we provide competitive base salaries, equity, and benefits that are inclusive of the best talent out there.\xa0\n\nSalary transparency mitigates the wage gap\nWe’re building systems that level the playing field for everyone. Our salaries and levels are open to all Nextmvers to view and understand. \n\nEvery function and location provides equal value\nThe base salary for any two employees at the same level is the same — whether they’re in San Francisco or Philadelphia, finance or engineering.\xa0\n\nYou don’t have to give up your craft to make more money\nBuilding a career at Nextmv should be straightforward. We give you the tools to own your growth — whether that’s on a path as an individual contributor or people manager.\xa0\n\n\nHow We Hire\nThis is the structure of our interview process. It is conducted entirely over Zoom.\n\nApplication: Tell us about your experience. Everyone who applies hears back about the status of their application.\n\nHiring manager screen: Meet with the hiring manager to discuss what you're looking for and if there is alignment with the team's needs.\n\nSmall Project + Tech Interview: Showcase your skills with a short take-home project that you'll be able to discuss with 1-2 members of our team.\n\nCulture interview: Speak with 1-2 cross-functional team members to learn more about how we work and discuss values alignment.\n\nExecutive call: Meet Carolyn (CEO), Ryan (CTO) or Andrew (COO), to discuss where we’re headed as a company. \n\n#Salary and compensation\n
No salary data published by company so we estimated salary based on previous jobs related to Executive, Engineer jobs that are similar:\n\n
$70,000 — $110,000/year\n
\n\n#Location\nRemote

["Imperfect Foods is hiring a Remote Director of Data 
About Imperfect\n\nImperfect Foods was founded in 2015 with a mission to reduce food waste and build a better food system for everyone. We offer imperfect (yet delicious) produce, affordable pantry items, and quality meat and dairy. Our customers can get the healthy, seasonal produce they want alongside the grocery staples they rely on, without having to compromise their budget or values. We’re proving that doing the right thing for the planet doesn’t have to cost more, and that shopping for quality ingredients can support the people and resources that it takes to grow our favorite foods. \n\nWe're headquartered in San Francisco with operations all over the country!\n\nPlease consider completing the optional Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) survey below. Doing so will help keep us accountable for the DEI commitments we have made as a company. By choosing to disclose elements of your identity, you are informing us about our candidate pool and the ways we can continue to improve making Imperfect Foods an inclusive company for everyone. Responses will in no way affect your candidacy for the position you apply for.\xa0 Information collected will be kept secure and confidential and will be used solely to evaluate our DEI efforts. We thank you in advance for helping us to become a better company for people of all backgrounds.\n\nAbout the Role:\n\nData is the nervous system of our company informing every decision and customer interaction. The Director of Data is responsible for ensuring data is a competitive advantage for us by executing our data strategy, establishing a data-driven culture throughout Imperfect, building data-centered customer experiences, and leading and growing our Data team. Our Data team includes data analysts, data scientists, and data engineers.\n\n\nImperfect's commitment to DEI\nImperfect Foods is steadfast in its commitment to being an\xa0actively anti-racist company.\nWe understand that it is necessary to take ownership and accountability for building an equitable workplace where all members of our organization can truly belong. It is only with everyone’s unique perspectives, experiences, and beliefs that we can help shape a culture of belonging and create an environment where all Imperfectionists are celebrated.\n\nU.S. E-Verify Notice: Imperfect Foods participates in E-Verify in the United States. ['Cube is hiring a Remote Product Designer

["ResearchGate is hiring a Remote Brand Designer

You'll join the small, scrappy Brand Design team and help tell the story of ResearchGate through beautifully designed collateral. Roughly 25% of your time will be devoted to the creative exploration of improving our brand's visual identity and 75% of the time will be focused on design execution.\xa0\n\nResponsibilities\n\n• Build the ResearchGate brand system through style guides, templates, iconography, typography, and visual imagery.\n• Execute the on-time delivery of high quality design collateral, including web pages, marketing materials, presentations, social campaigns, blog posts, and more.\n• Collaborate with Marketing to produce high-impact landing pages, case studies, and reports that help grow our business and set us apart from the competition.\xa0\n• Collaborate with Product Design to elevate the visual design of the ResearchGate platform and unify the design systems of the product and brand into a single visual language.\xa0\n• Create internal design processes that ensure that we can meet the design needs of the entire company at speed and scale.\n• Maintain design consistency while looking for ways to elevate ResearchGate's brand, keeping it fresh and innovative.\n\nRequirements\n\n• Enthusiasm for design! Your heart beats faster when you see a clever logo, a gorgeous display font, an experimental poster for this weekend's DJ lineup, an eco-chic bag of artisanal coffee or a shelf of tastefully arranged vinyl record covers.\xa0\n• Good taste and a keen, critical eye! You can find the one good option in a mountain of bad stock photos. You have a 6th sense for when body copy is too big and when photo captions are too small. You halt the presses if you see misaligned text and beam with pride when shipping pixel-perfect designs.\xa0\n• A point of view! You don't aspire to play it safe and mimic every other startup's 3-column grid of free icons—you want to make designs with personality. Enjoy an energetic and international team who are passionate about changing science for the better.\xa0\n\nOur headquarters are located at the heart of Berlin, one of the most exciting cities in the world. We are a digital-first organisation and support mobile and flexible working. This role is based in Germany and candidates must be already resident in Germany, or be willing to relocate.\n\n\n\n \n\n#Location\nGermany. Our Headquarters Are in Berlin and We Support a Hybrid Home Office/in Person Approach to Work.
